text:
750 mL bottle. Originally reviewed 8/29/2011. 

Crystal clear gold body with a huge white head.The head never fully dissipates and the lace sticks to the glass. Smells like a hoppy tripel. All the great hop flavors of an IPA with the complex citric fruits of a tripel. Some honey and spice flavors behind that. Belgian yeast aromas abound, as well.

Taste is a little bit of a letdown from the smell, but still good. Hoppy up front with some nice Belgian spice. Sweetness in the middle, which is a bit much. Finishes like bitter honey.
Very heavy for such an effervescent smell. By the end of the bottle, its almost syrupy and a bit hard to drink. I expected more of a dry finish at such a high ABV, but its still sweet at the end. A little drier and less sweetness and this would be spot on.

You gotta love when you tumble on greatness. Strong taste with perfect balance, even for a strong beer. This is my 150th beer since I started discovering beer, what a good fit for this mark. My first from Charlevoix. Cant wait to try others.

Botella en 99 Cervezas. 
Vierte en dorado claro, brillante y perfectamente transparente. Buena carbonatación con algunos hilos de burbujas subiendo a la superficie. Abundante espuma blanca, bastante cremosa aunque de burbuja media-grande. Buena persistencia y mejor adherencia. Un aspecto realmente impresionante. 
Intensidad media-alta en nariz. Notas frutales que podrían ser de ciruela blanca y de plátano muy ténue. Suaves notas de Jazmín, así como un punto terroso y suavemente especiado, acompañado de algo de limón y hierba fresca. También, muy de base, notas leñosas y lupuladas. Buena complejidad en nariz, muy equilibrada. Lo que está absolutamente ausente es el alcohol, lo que resulta muy sorprendente en una cerveza de 10% ABV, chapeau! 
En boca, el sabor predominante es por supuesto el dulce, aunque el amargo no le va en absoluto a la zaga, lo que resulta sorprendente en una cerveza de la escuela belga (no tan sorprendente si tenemos en cuenta que está elaborada en Canadá, con la lógica influencia de la escuela americana). Conforme evoluciona en boca el dulce va cediendo paso al amargo, presentando una persistencia notable. En cada trago se repite el proceso, un inicio dulce que es enseguida barrido por un amargor ligeramente picante y muy agradable (no agresivo). Tampoco en boca se deja notar su alta graduación alcohólica. 
Es de cuerpo medio y textura como de vino espumoso y a la vez chispeante y picante. Una espuma muy fina se forma también en la lengua cada vez que damos un sorbo. Muy interesante. 
Una cerveza muy bien equilibrada y a la vez con carácter. Aspecto fantástico, deliciosa en nariz y evolución en boca más que interesante. Una cerveza que deberías probar si tienes ocasión. Sin duda.

750ml bottle from LCBO. 9.3% alc/vol. Pours a clear gold colour with one finger of lasting head. Lacing clinging to the side of the glass. I get tons of hoppy and fruity aromas on the nose. Notes of grapefruit, oranges, pine, and honey. Taste matches the aroma with some lemony taste. The finish is well-balanced and semi-dry from the hops. Medium-bodied with moderate carbonation. I think this beer is closer in style to Belgian IPA than the traditional Belgian Strong Ale. Excellent brew. This is a must-try, if youre into Belgian Strong Ales or IPAs.

750 ml bottle. Hazy golden colour, thick white head. Fruity aroma with sweetish malt, citrus and yeast notes, and a whiff of spices and grassy hops. The flavour is sweetish malty, with ripe fruits, citrus and banana notes, and an aromatic hoppy finish with a bit of warming alcohol. Warm spicy aftertaste. Delicious and well balanced.

Blonde dorée, carbo moyenne, collet épais et persistant, superbe dentelle.
Aromes axés sur les céréales, pain, miel, mais le cote fleuri et fruite des houblons nest pas en reste même si on est on est plus dans la subtilité que sur des IPAs.
En bouche cest une fois de plus bien travaille et tout en finesse.
Amertume longue et relativement seche en finale, Ronde, sur le malt en attaque, la finale est plus fruité sur une pointe dagrume.

A big pillowy, sustained white head on a yellow straw body. A fresh and engaging nose features citrus and floral hops, sweet malt and grain. This beer is a study in fresh, well balanced tastes. Understated Belgian yeast with a banana accent, lemon, pineapple and green apples, floral hops, sweet bready malt and a touch of cloves all blend well into a refreshing profile. Solid effervescence, a medium body and a slick but not cloying mouth feel are assets.
Very solid. Fresh and citrusy, bright yellow/straw color. Perfectly white fluffy head. Lots of tropical fruit aromas.

UPDATED: OCT 10, 2016 Bottle from LCBO: massive, creamy head that expands and lasts, and produces an excellent lace. Golden colour. The nose is grain, malt, ripe fruit, and hops with some clove, spice, and yeast. The taste is a conjured complexity of fermented pear and pineapple with a somewhat herbal character. Grains and malts make up a backbone that offers sweetness upfront and subtle bitterness in the finish. Slick mouthfeel, and a high alcohol profile that is well hidden. Robust yet pleasantly smooth and balanced. Enjoyed it with Thanksgiving fare. Exquisitely crafted ale that?s a must have for anyone?s personal reserve.

750ml bottle from Saveur-Biere. Oravankolo tasting.


Clear yellow body with a big white head. Fruity, yeast, some booz. Okay.
Just an all round quality beer. This beer is good anytime, with practically any type of food.

Drank w Matt after Danis birthday. Creamy hazy beige, slightly dull but with a massive pillowy fluffy white head. Smells of woody bitter hop, musty yeast, moderate spicy grainy malt, fermented pear and apple, light clove. Taste is very deeply bitter, woody grassy wheat, yeasty and lightly peppery. Body is stony and bitter, frothy wet spicy grainy slightly fizzy finish. Lots of stony bitterness to complement the yeast and spicy malt. This bottle didnt taste too fresh - or just muddy flavour of the yeast?

750ml bottle (4/2016 I think) from Gatineau Broue Ha Ha at home in HK. Hazy golden pour with very big puffy dense head with lots of structure. Aroma is not that strong - maybe the beer isnt super fresh? - bitter Belgian notes. Taste is bitter, spicy, sweet grain, stone fruit - more sweet than tart. Very balanced and certainly, as others note, doesnt seem like its 10% despite the boozy finish. Not as hoppy as I expected unfortunately, and not a style I tend to enjoy, but a nicely balanced very elegantly crafted beer.

750 ml bottle. Bottled on 2014/11/11. Thanks Timo A. for sharing!
Clear golden color with a small white head. 
Belgian yeast, sweet malt and mild spices in the aroma.
Hops, Belgian style yeast, freshness, sweet malt and spices in the flavor. Strong flavor. Lagery. Some sweetness in the aftertaste.

Jaune brillante avec une petite robe blanche. Larôme est bordée des agrumes et fruits tropicaux avec un tout petit peu de sucre. En bouche cest très fraîche avec aucun signe quelle sapproche 10%. Cest la bière le plus fruitée que jai jamais goûter (excluant les bières de fruit). Plein de corps, plein de fruits et une bonne final amer. Formidable.
Hazy, yellow orange body, gigantic white head. Very lively. The aroma is warm, with subtle berries. The taste is amazing. Very balanced and not overly hoppy.

Bottle from LCBO. Bottled Dec 2015. Pours almost all creamy white foam at first, then a clear bright golden body starts to appear. Head retention good, lace too. Nose and flavour of citric biscuits and a warmer stone fruit tonality, its so nicely balanced between mellow sweetness and bitterness, its so smooth without veering into any extremities. Carbonation, body, palate - all lovely. All in all nothing exceptional, nothing too fancy, but oh my how simply good this is... I downed the whole 750 ml during 2 hours without even noticing : /

Une bière que jai négligé trop longtemps. On mapporte cette coupe rayonnante et fraîche comme peu de bière peuvent se vanter de lêtre! Une mousse blanche maculée couronne ce riche liquide et ne sestompe que très lentement en laissant sur mon verre une dentelle des plus élaborées. Nez plutôt malté où le houblon à leuropéenne apporte fraîcheur et légèreté. Un malt caramélisé, un houblon aérien. Corps très agréable en bouche où le malt caramélisé sexprime sans retenue sans jamais écoeurer ni alourdir mon palais. Cette bière au corps indéniablement affirmé est légère et se boit dun trait, si on a le malheur doublier ses 10% dalcool. Vive effervescence de fines bulles, malts caramélisés, houblons croustillants. Amertume moyenne, une Grande Bière que jai trop longtemps mise de côté.

Hazy straw color with powerful subtle activity. Super foamy white 4 finger expanding island head, lasting around 20 minutes, with strong legs.

Aromas of sweet malty grains, citrus, and a little vinous. Flavors of lemon, apple, pear, caramel, floral and herbal spices. Pleasant sweet grainy biscuity feel with a nice citrus sharpness. Balanced taste and not too boozy.

Slick medium body with perfect carbonation. Well intensified medium strength finish of short length, ending with a clean sharp citrus and slightly spicy noble hops feel.

Overall a very good craft with a super fresh taste of delicious complex flavors, while the nose is a little faint. Very easy to drink and quite treacherous.

2016/04/19 - Pours a hazy, yellow honey colour with a thick, foamy, white head that slowly reduces and leaves ample lacing. Aroma is amazing; Belgian yeast, banana, cloves, pear, tropical fruits, grass and a hint of butter (not unpleasant). Taste is cloves, doughy yeast, banana, pineapple, pear, peach, spicy hops and light alcohol. Mouthfeel is medium and silky with smooth carbonation and a finish that is slightly drying and mildly warming. I can't believe that it has taken me this long to try this beer. Exceptionally balanced while being complex and masterfully hiding the ABV. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Wow. Quel équilibre! Typée abbaye avec des houblons plutôt aromatiques, je mattendais à quelque chose de plus déroutant et pourtant ! Belle teinte claire, avec une mousse fine mais persistante, une amertume initiale bien présente, longue, mais vite équilibrée par des notes dagrumes et de fleurs. Un peu dépices herbacés, et une fin légèrement acidulée et durable. Son centille est loin dêtre usurpé !
On tap at Cara B. Golden colour with white head. Malt, grass, hops and yeast aoma. Sweet, grass, malt, yeast and fruity taste. Medium body
75cl bottle. Light hazy color. Thin persistent white head. Medium sweetness and bitterness. Aroma is super fruity, spicy, malty. Super balanced. Where are the 10%?

Surprise treat from Mrs Tiki this evening. Decants a misty golden with beautiful serious layers of foam across the surface. Pungent aromas promise fresh flavour goodness. Grapefruit, bubblegum & lemongrass. Pine needles shine from the indulgent hops. Fresh dough, perfume, champagne. Fantastic balance. Subtle swirls of flavour. Dreamy mouthfeel. Alcohol is present but almost buried in the tasty goodness. My buddy Hippyhop nails it in his review when he suggests you have two options upon opening the bottle: share it with a friend or drink it solo & ascend to the heights a serious buzz. Im working the latter option.
Pours cloudy honey with a creamy white head. Aroma notes include apple, pear, banana, clove, and yeast. Tasting notes include apple, pear, peppery yeast, and a dry finish. Fantastic!

750ml bottle (thanks martjoobolut). Clear golden color. Small size, white head, stays. Malty, sweet, perfume, dough, some buttery notes in aroma. Perfume, cookies, malty, sweet, spicy hops in taste. Sweet malts, perfume and spicy hops in aftertaste. Medium carbonation. Alcohol is quite well covered. Nice one.

UPDATED: MAR 26, 2016 Bottle, shared by Mart. Clear golden yellow, medium white head. Nose is sweet, shortbread, yeast, fruit, hops, mild perfume. Flavor is more shortbread, mild yeast, fruit, sugar, pineapple, grassy notes in the finish with warm alcohol. Fizzy palate, but the flavors feel creamy. Nice.

UPDATED: MAR 26, 2016 Bottle (from saveur bier), 2014 vintage. Pours golden with whiteish head. The head stays for some time. Aroma is sweet, honey, fruits, citrus, candy, perfumy. Flavor is sweet, bitter and slightly sour, fresh fruits, apples, sugar, malt. Carbonation is rather high. Finish is intense dry bitter with warming alcohol and sweetness. Overall: very nice.
Bottle share at RBB. Pour is very cloudy yellow with a small white head. Flavor and aroma of pale malt, belgian yeast, sugar, and crackers. Finish is similar with a tad of booze.

75 cl bottle, served in snifter. Pours dim hazy golden with green tones. Head is white and doesnt last too long. Nice lacing though. The nose is fantastic: intense aromas of ripe fruit (peach, apricot, mango, melon, grapefruit, pineapple, passionfruit, lemon) accompanied by sweet scents of biscuit, vanilla, cinnamon, caramel... Theres also a sub-layer of other luscious odors: honey, brioche, herbs... Incredibly complex. What about the mouthfeel? Lets see: creamy, very soft, silky and with a carbonation so soft Id describe it as velvety. Round flavors, all of them present and well balanced, with a great bitter long finish that lasts for more than two minutes. An amazing ale, congratulations to the brewers.

75cl bottle all for myself :) ...the beer looks good, well carbonated with a big head. Aroma is spicy, peppery with fruity esters like peach, abricot, some banana, apple ...perfect. It has also traces of acetaldehyde and phenolic aromas but in the perfect, loved by Belgian strong ale drinkers like me. With a first sip the carbonation is confirmed to be strong but the body is creamy. Flavors are strong and each sip is warming. Really good one.

Pale yellow translucent white with a nice foamy head that leaves a good mark on the glass while dissipates. The smell is slightly sweet, with hints of biscuits, grapefruit, pineapple, grass, pine, hay and lemon zest. The palate spectacular balance between sweet and sour, with new notes of cookies, white bread, grapefruit, kumquats, pineapple, mango, dry soil, hay, lemon zest and hints of alcohol. Soft feeling while stout, slightly dry.

[1/30/16] Bottle sample at the Encomium bottle share, after RateBeer Best awards ceremony at Hyatt Vineyard Creek Hotel in Santa Rosa. Thanks everyone who shared bottles! Hazy yellow. Fruity, flowers, citrus, earthy spiciness. Dry, bitter hops.

Typical belgian strong ale but in its class one of the best I have ever tasted. Contains vanilla, banana and citrus and forest fruits. Perfect balance between sweetness and bitterness and between malts and hops. Smooth mouthfeel. Alcohol hardly noticeable. Very very good.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at the Rate Beer Awards Festival Bottle Share. Thanks to JulienHuxley for finding me to share. Bright, crisp hops in the nose, along with Belgian yeast, lemon, citrus, dough. Flavor is sweet orange and lemon, crisp malt, creackers. Lightly yeasty, with solid bitterness and great lemony fruit. A great New World Belgian Strong. Glad I finally got to try it. Why cant more North American brewers do Belgian like this?

Halovány aranysárga színe fölött tömött, pöffeszkedő, hófehér hab fejlődik sebesen, világos árnyalata némi meglepetéssel is szolgál, miután elméletileg "belgian strong ale"-ről van szó. Karakterisztikája alapján ugyanis inkább tűnik valami vadabb, élénkebb italnak, mivelhogy tripelesen csípős, gabonás, ámde IPA-szerűen komlóvezérelt jegyeket egyaránt megcsillant úgy illatában, mint ízében, mely utóbbi amellett, hogy vibráló és könnyed, telt és gazdag is egyben. Na nem az a kirobbanó, malátaszirupos jelleg, inkább a fűszeresebb, pezsgőbb hangulatú, szénsavval alaposan teletűzdelt típus, amiben a komló a szokásosnál erőteljesebben képviselteti magát, túlsúlyba azonban nem kerül, a főzet harmóniáját sem bontja meg. Ez utóbbi jellemvonás egyébként a legnagyobb erénye az italnak, letisztult ízvilág, egyszerű, de minden szempontból kielégítő a test. Almás, száraz pezsgős, kenyeres és élesztős jegyek egyaránt megcsillannak a testben, összességében változatos benyomások sorát hordozva. Ha helyénvaló is a ráragasztott kategória, annak a könnyedebb, ha úgy tetszik populárisabb verzióját szolgáltatja, ami miatt a magam részéről talán tartózkodnék az élmezőnyben elhelyezni az italt, amellett, hogy természetesen egy kiemelkedően jó főzetről van szó.

0.75l bottle thanks to Lore. Clear golden body, white head. Aroma of grapes, bread, champagne yeast, orange zest and grasses. Taste of bread, honey, orange zest, grassy hops and grape must. Truly awesome beer.

opalescent golden colour, minimal off-white head; aroma of intensive fruitiness, citruses, malty-caramel sweetness, floral and earthy notes and some minimal alcohol; taste of fruits, citruses, hints of honey, malty sweetness, some spices and signs of alcohol; dry mouthfeel; amazing beer! It was the best masterpiece of a great beer tasting - at least from my side :-) thank you very much, kapusil! :-)

Keg @El Lúpulo Feroz, Oviedo. 23-11-2015.
In short: belgian strong ale with alcohol well hidden.
A very clear pale golden strong ale, plenty of belgian yeast character, sweet, bready, alcohol very well integrated. Surprised by the 100/100 rating, it´s a good beer, but not the best style example.
Couleur jaune trouble, légère mousse. Nez levures et fruité agrumes. Gout doux sucré raisin, fruits jaunes et agrumes. Fin de bouche sucrée avec légères épices.

Bottle 75cl, a clear golden beer with huge head. Nose is is intense on belgian yeast, oranges, quince.A very sweet beer with caramel, orange, quince notes, much more drinkable than the Hibernus, dry finish. Body is on peppery hops, grassy notes, candy sugar, background grapefruit notes.

75cl bottle shared at home. Clear golden with a medium white soapy head. Full body with low to moderate carbonation. Quite sweet with subtle bitterness. Peach, tropical fruits, citrus, spices and yeast. Good brew, but a tad too sweet.

Golden color with a white head, good duration. Aroma has strong notes spicies with light yeasty hints. Flavor is moderate sweet, strong yeast with a high presence of spicy notes. Light sweetness on palate changing to a mild bitterness in the final.

Bottle shared by Erwin Van Moll @ Brewpub Van Moll. Hazy yellow color, some yeast residu in it, full sized white head that lasts for a decent while. Aroma is malts, lightly yeast, a soft underlying fruityness. Taste lightly malts, yeast, again a subtle light underlying fruityness probably coming from the yeast, slightly alcohol and a slight hint of fruitpeel bitterness. Very balanced, smooth mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Impressive brew, I must admit.

Pours slightly hazy, golden. Thin white head, lots of lacing. Faint, floral Jasmine aroma. Taste is bitter, with faint citrus. Finishes with a powerful, astringent flavor of Jasmine and soap. Light body, soft carbonation. Deceptively light for the 10% ABV, but overwhelmingly floral and lacking balance.
Aroma alcohólico evidente por la alta graduación, centeno fermentado, caramelo. La primera belgian strong ale, muy buena. 100% recomendable.

Its about time I review this one! 750 ml 1 year old bottle! Golden straw color and massive sustained head! wow I smell a hoppy champain! Lemon/Citrus notes and ripe grapefruits. The better the beer is, the more speechless I get. Man THAT BALANCE! I may have a new beer in my top 5!
Floral hops are through the roof, a little sourness that joins the biterness and the fruityness. creamy finish. Great Stuff!!

Dorado lechoso y pesuma blanca abundante y densa. Aromas de fruta amarilla madura, lima, menta fresca. Cuerpo medio, inicio dulce de la futa amarilla madura, sabor fresco ligeramente cítrico y final de amargor equilibrado y seco.

Bottle from the LCBO. Cloudy medium gold with a huge pillowy white head that hangs around and leaves lots of patchy lace. Nose is brown sugar, honey, bread, citrus, spice and flowers. Medium + sweet caramel with peppery yeast notes and some pear along with with some medium grassy bitterness. Notes of tart apricot come out as it warms. Mouth is medium + and sticky with average carbonation. Lots of layers with the alcohol well integrated. A little on the sweet side.

On tap at the brewpub.
Makes more sense no that I know its a triple, thought it was a double ipa, damn language barrier.

Poured a pale yellow colour, big foamy bubbly head. Pretty good lacing, head sticks around for a while. Has a nice malty and hoppy aroma, hint of grapefruits and oranges. The flavour is great with a mixture of grapefruit, lemon, yeast, light malts and citrus. Sweet and tangy mouthfeel. For an abv of 10%, it is not noticeable at all. Quite deceiving, but no complaints. Well, maybe a bit pricey, but the wine-looking bottle is nice. Damn good!

Bottle shared at Borefts beer fest day 2 27/09/2014. Bodegraven. Many thanks to whomever shared this. Clear golden / straw coloured pour with lasting fine head. Aroma is delicate floral spicy notes with nice belgian yeast, and floral lemon. Flavour is composed of sweet midget gem hop, honey, floral, some warming alcohol, Very decent. Palate is semi sweet parma violets, high spritzy carbonation.
Very balanced hops in this beer. Realy enjoying the nice head caused by the microbubbles. Great beer!

Énormément de levure, des biscuits, de la poire et dautres frtuits tropicaux, miam miam. Juste assez floue pour être encore magnifique ;-)
Mes souvenirs me rappelaient bien plus dalcool que perçu lors de cette récente dégustation. Vraiment une excellente bière!!
Yeasty, zesty aroma. Flavour of dark fruits and sugars. Not a bad belgian at all. Would drink again.

Gros colle de mousse qui tien solidement. Draft de camomille,pêche,même de la cantaloup,clémentine,figues séchés. une levure épicé viens ouvrir le bal, bien houblonné,le balancement est hallucinant.Bien pétillante, finale longue et suave , très rafraichissante en même temps , une grande bière

Bottle received by winter santa 13/14. Thank you pushkinwow! Pours hazy pale yellow with a huge frothy white head that leaves tons of trace on the glass while dissipating. Smell is tiny sweet, tiny estery and slightly phenolic with crackers, grapefruit, pineapple, grass, pine, hay and lemon zest. Taste is tiny sweet, bitter, tiny estery and slightly phenolic with crackers, white bread, grapefruit, pineapple, mango, dry soil, hay, lemon zest and hints of alcohol. Mouthfeel is soft, slightly dry, round and medium to full bodied. Finish is slightly bitter with crackers, toffee, grapefruit, hay, dry soil, grass, pine needles, kumquats and lemon zest. Nice.
Bottle from Guyon farm. Aroma: Belgian yeast, banana floral. App: hazy yellow, frothy head. Taste and palate: full body, lively carbonation..overall: really good beer, nice head.
Bottle at Borefts. Hazy gold lasting white head. Hoppy kind of Belgian hoppy. big hoppy blond ale. Clean. Excellent. Bitter.

Bottle: Thanks Pushkinwow: Served in a wine glass:
Bigger white head on top of a hazy orange colored beer.
Aroma if fruity with some spice, herbs and some hops with a yeasty edge.
Flavours of honey, herbs, some malts, light floral, hint of white pepper, light dry, light hoppy, bitter and some some rice.
Aftertaste is herbal, bitter, floral, light rice and a spice touch.
Low carbo, creamy mouthfeel, medium to fulller bodied and a light creamy texture
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Beautiful solid white head, gold colour, fairly clear. Aroma is fruity, little bit spicy yeast. Not loads of hops. Taste is a bit of Chardonnay, fruity with a but of a spicy finish. Really good. Touch of sweetness in there too. Feel is sort of dry but not too much so. Really nice.

Clear golden colour, firm white head. Aroma of malts, light funky yeast, floral, herbal and spicy. Rather sweet flavour, malts, mild bitterness, yeast. Bit fruity. Finish malts, light sweetness.(From 75cL bottle @ Bodegraven. Shared by kraddel. Thanks!)

At BBF 14 . 
Pours clear blonde , huge white head . 
Smell is sweet malts , yeast . Bit honey . Low carbo . 
Taste is bitter , sweet , malty. Very yeasty and buttery
sampled @ Borefts Beer Festival 2014: Trübes strohgelbes Bier mit ordentlicher weißer Schaumkrone. Geruch hefig, würzig, hopfig. Geschmack hefig, fruchtig, süß, hopfig, grasig, lecker!

Bottle at de molen 2014 golden yellow... Thin white lacing... Soft bready floral fruit light salty nose... Soft sweet fruits... Soft sweet floral fruit.. Sift light salty floral hop... Light hibiscus fruits linger

Bottle from Le Gobelet. Made with Amarillo, Simcoe & Strisselspalt. A light straw gold with an incredibly thick fluffy head. Sweet bready, cinnamon fruity & funky Belgian notes that is very approachable and appetizing. The taste is a really good Trappist style fruity, spicy bready beer. Probably one of the best Belgians made outside of Belgian.


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap. Golden body with large, lacing and off-white head. Aroma of toasted caramel, herbs, orange, piney notes and yeast. Sweet flavor that ends up more dry and slightly bitter. Medium bodied, oily texture and soft carbonation. Anexcellent Belgian Strong.

Je suis un impie! Quest-ce qui se passe pour cette bière? Attentes trop élevées? Style qui nest pas mien? Jessaie...mon corps refuse! Cest paille aux reflets verdâtres. Le col sémoustille et disparaît rapidement. Effervescence plus que présente. Le nez est alcooleux, après miel et céréales se tagteam. Encore de lalcool...10% vous me direz? Et pourtant ... question déquilibre. Funambule sans filet qui joue dangereusement. La fleur dans lacool, le miel à lalcool, la poire william et leau-de-vie, la vie sans leau. Cest capiteux, chaleureux, nerveux, ça tiraille et cest chaud chaud chaud. Est-ce la bouteille qui est défectueuse ? Je donnerai une autre chance, un autre jour...à ce prix, on comprendra que ... ça coûte.

This beer is something else. It smells almost like a sauvignon blanc or a chardonnay. Sweet fruit and heavy dryness, this stuff is intense. 
Taste is ripe fruit with a bit of spice. Heavy alcohol taste, but as soon as you notice it, a big floral hop finish just washes it away, which is very nice, and very dangerous. This is a beautiful beer, but its 10% alcohol and Ive only ever seen it in 750ml bottles, so you either have to share it with friends or commit to getting drunk before you crack it open. I see no problem with either scenario.

Classy bottle, a name referential to the Christian god and able to hide its alcohol with more alacrity and artistry than the town drunk? Im in! Hazy pale yellow with a gigantic and frothy white crown of thorns. A wondrous stench of hay, floral hops, honey, grass, basement and yeast. It has a lightly sweet and somewhat vinous taste to it as well as a soft carbonated body that ends with a crisp wheat finish.

Definitely the most quaffable Belgian strong ale I have had, not overpowering at all. Poured a straw colour with a big frothy head that stuck around. Aroma was of tropical fruit, floral hops, grass. Tasted fruity with honey and floral hops, also had a nice sweetness to it. Had a medium body that was highly carbonated with a tingly feel. Plus it hides its booze levels like a champ. Impressed with this brew.

Hazy golden with a thick white foam. Aroma is complex, spice, citrus, pears, lemon, alcohol, cereal notes, herbal. Taste is mainly sweet with a litte bitter and tart aftertaste. Aftertaste is long and has a little annoying thing. Body is round and slick, with a nice, lively carbonation. A great one from this serie!

pours an amber-brown with thin head. hop aroma. highly hopped, but bitterness is balanced. Some Belgian yeast on the tongue. However, alcohol finish is overly pronounced significantly diminishing the flavour profile.

Pours a slightly hazy gold with a massive three fingers of fizzy white head, gradually settling down and leaving behind heavy lacing. Nose is Belgian yeast, banana, caramel, slight piney and citrus hops. Taste follows suit with grapefruit, pine, and pepper. Mouth feel is medium bodied, with a lingering bitter finish.

Wow - another amazing beer out of Quebec. Apparently theyre not satisfied with cornering the market on strippers and poutine, now theyve got to out-Belgium the Belgians! This is pure Belgian all the way - brilliant yeasty nose and minimal sweetness on the tongue. Idve liked a little more clove phenol character, but this is world class regardless.

UPDATED: DEC 24, 2015 100ml sample. Cloudy straw, big head. Spicy and fruity - black pepper, green pepper, fragrant orchard fruit, some honey, alcohol. Smooth mouth-feel and easy drinking. Excellent.

6-MAY-2014. BOTTLE 75CL courtesy of bunget. Mulțumesc, Sergiu.

Look: bright yellow-gold and hazy, giant creamy white head with good retention.
Aroma: perfume, blond fruit, sweet citrus, tangerine, apricot, light spice, spicy herbal finish.
Taste: fruit balanced by herbal spice and light phenolic finish.
Excellent! 8-4-8-4-16=4.0

Very nice, smooth but full bodied. Hops are not overpowering like many other similar beers. The name is a fitting match considering the quality. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle thanks to MesandSim, sterling work for the beer cause as ever. Slightly hazy gold with a thin to medium white head. Aroma is fairly subtle but its all there! You get a sniff of the strength which I like, hardly noticeable in the flavour. Just hugely drinkable and tasty. Peach, pear, great mouthfeel. Cake. Lemons. Sweetness is bang on. Never had anything from this brewery before, this really is a great beer.

Pours a hazy golden with loads of fizzy white head. Aroma is initially belgian yeast, fruity, caramel, slight pine. As it warms though some of those citrus hops come through. Taste is nice, sweet and sticky, hoppy but certainly not that hoppy. Enjoyable.

Bouteille de 750 ml de la cuvée 2007 achetée chez Bière Expert à St-Jérôme au coût de $12.99. Dégustée le 1er juillet 2009 (Dominus Vobiscum glass). Bière blonde voilée tirant sur le doré. Mousse énormément, col blanc très très épais, pas uniforme (genre meringue) et très persistant. Très très effervescente (bulles fines). Arôme de levure, de miel et de crème. Alcool bien présent mais ne ressort pas trop, assez sucrée et peu amère. Goût de levure marqué, de miel et dépices. Finale plutôt sèche et épicée. Cette bière est complexe et bien équilibrée, se boit facilement malgré lalcool. Cette bière est excellente et comparable aux meilleures belges, elle na aucun défaut flagrant.

Pours a clear yellow color with a large white head with lots of carbonation. Nose is citrus, a bit of banana some fruit and mild spice and the typical belgian yeast. Medium body. Light bitter taste with lightly sweet as well and a medium hoppy finish! Excellent!

Pours a cloudy golden orange with large white head that slowly settles a decent leaves tons of lace. Aroma is citrus, floral, lightly spicy, moderate phenols, perfumey, and a mild malty sweetness. Flavour is spicy peppery Belgian yeast phenols, citrus, alcohol, perfumey notes, light floral notes and a medium dry finish.

Pours a lightly hazy golden color with a big frothy white head and lots of lace up the glass. Aroma of citrus hops, light fruity esthers, peppery phenols, cloves, alcohol and some spicy earthy hops. Taste is grapefruit, pine, spicy saaz hops, light fruits, spicy peppery phenols, Belgian yeast and a nice alcohol warming on the finish. Nice semi dry finish with medium carbonation. Excellent Belgian golden strong ale... Best Ive had to date!

Pours a clear golden with a thin white head that leaves light lacing only. Nose is of yellow fruits and a little phenolic (just like the belgians do it). Taste is fruity and sweet, pears is what I would say. Finish is spicy/peppery and not too long. Alcohol? Hidden expertly. Body is medium-full. A great beer, a Quebec classic I would say!
Banana cake. Bready, Apple, tart, pepper, oak, sour finish. Lovely creamy Belgian, plenty of flavors nicely coming out of the yeast.

750ml bottle. Hazy golden with a huge frothy white head. Flavors are citrus, grass, bread, dough, tropical fruits and pine resin with spicy and floral hops. Full body, lively carbonation, smooth texture.

Pours murky brown with a tan head. Aroma of boozy caramel, that strong Belgian beer with a few years on it effect, also a little herbal taking the edge of the heavy sweetness coming out in the flavour. Full bodied with flat carbonation. No idea what it was like fresh, but very nice with some age.

Couleur doré avec un superbe collet. La levure dégage des notes épicées au nez, poivre et de camomille. Houblonnage parfait : terreux et agrumes. La complexité des saveurs est bien répartie entre le floral, les épices et le sucre. Une grande bière !!!

Bottle, with thanks to Sebastien! Pours hazy orange with a large off-white head and nice lacing on the glass. Aroma is orangey, pine, caramel, some leaves, yeast, fruity. Taste is medium sweet, light bitter, quite fruity, kind of reminds me of a cross between a sweet triple and a hoppy barley wine with enough age on it that most of the hop character has faded. Finish is fairly bitter. Medium body, creamy mouthfeel. Mixed emotions...

750 ml. 2010 bottle. Thanks deyholla! Pours a somewhat cloudy golden orange with a fabulous meringue head. One of the best looking pours ever. Mild aroma of fruit, yeast, and floral. Taste is sweet fruits, yeast, malt, spice, and floral. Truly a special experience. Now to find a newer release!
Clear golden color, lots and lots of foam. Interesting aroma, it has a little German hefe with banana notes, fruity. Very fruity flavor, totally hefe with lots of alcohol. Too much.

UPDATED: JAN 6, 2014 Ce divin liquide dun magnifique éclat doré offre un superbe collet duveteux. Plutôt trouble, des lignes artistiques de dentelle saccrochent au verre pour notre plus grand plaisir. La levure dégage des notes épicées au nez, notamment de poivre et de camomille. Lhoublonnage entre dans la danse en bouche et on dénote des houblons terreux et des agrumes (orange). La complexité des saveurs est toutefois très bien répartie entre le floral, lépicé et le sucré. Une grande bière.

Évaluation no. 70 Février 2011. De couleur blonde. Claire au début puis brouillée au fur et à mesure que la levure se mélange au tout. Une mousse très abondante et persistante. Un nez très houblonné avec notes de bananes. Attaque tout en bananes avec accents de houblons. Des notes de caramel et de pêches. Excellent équilibre alcool / saveurs. Une bière exceptionnelle.

Pours hazy gold with a sturdy white head that leaves tons of lacing. Aroma of fruity yeast esters, dank hops, some spiciness, slight burnt rubber. Taste is kind of tart and sweet up front, kind of thick body with a firm hop finish that lingers. Nice hop taste here. This beer is pretty much all over the place but certainly interesting.

Bière jaune dorée, voilée, belle effervescence, surmontée dun très large col, dense et rocailleux laissant une formidable dentelle sur les parois du verre. Arômes surtout houblonnées, houblon floral et léger dépinette, avec de la levure, du pain, du grain frais, léger sucre dorge, des agrumes, de la pêche et des fruits tropicaux (cantaloup et mangue surtout). Très beau nez, assez intense, riche, complexe. En bouche, moyennement pétillante sur la langue, avec une excellente onctuosité au palais, cest soyeux, huileux, liquoreux. Au goût, dabord très douce en bouche, pain, sucre dorge, miel, pêche et fruits tropicaux, ensuite le houblon floral revendique sa domination, avec des pointes dépinette et dagrumes. Goût intense, riche et complexe, un véritable délice, un très gros coup de cur pour moi!

Bottled 750ml PBFVIII vintage 2010
Clearlish yellow-orange color, good steady white head, lace. Old socks and old hops in the nose. Medium-bodied, mellow. Fruity hoppyness, grassyness. Vintage 2010 has lost its best shape by now.

Hummm! Le nez est enivrant! Des fruits, beaucoup de pommes rouges. Un arôme exquis! En bouche, cest intense mais controllé. Assez originale, avec sa petite touche acidulée et son niveau dalcool élevé mais bien caché. Elle narrive pas à conquérir mon coeur, mais je comprends très bien quelle y parvienne avec plusieurs!
Couleur dorée trouble avec un col mousseux blanc. Nez de fruits et dépices. En bouche mélange complexe dépices et de fruits. Bière bien construite pas tout a fait mon genre par contre!

2010 Vintage
Tasted in late 2011 from a capped 750mL bottle obtained in a trade. Pours clear light orange with a thick white head that slowly recedes to thick lace. The nose is sweet and fruity with some spicy hops and yeast and lightly bitter hops aroma. The flavor is the same spicy hops and yeast with some dried peach and apricot pitted fruit, and finishing with some nice spicy bitterness. The body is full and very sticky with light carbonation and a long lightly sweet dried fruit and pleasantly bitter finish.

2007 capped 750 from Bu11zeye. Pours hazy orange gold with a creamy off-white head. In a Westvleteren chalice. Aroma is malty, floral/zestspicey. Med + body. Flavor is light toffee, bitter zest, earth, floral. Finishes that way - well blended. Not a trace of heat. Enchantingly delicious.

2007 bottle shared by bhensonb. Pours cloudy golden with an attractive off-white head and a citrus and toffee aroma. There is an earthy toffee flavor that has blended in with the hops over the years. Hopheads would likely be disappointed with this development with the "in your face" bitterness gone, but I love the aged flavor. Cannot detect the alcohol.
Excellente, arome fruite, gout complexe, épice sucre et amertume, chaude en bouche.

I had pretty high expectations going into this one and was anticipating a bit more of a hoppy presence and a little more body. It was certainly enjoyable, light bodied, mild hop, smooth aftertaste. Well balanced and pleasant but nothing spectacular. If it werent for the abv I would assume on flavour alone it wouldnt hold up to many lower abv peers.
Peach. Aroma is mild fruit, yeast. Taste is perfect strong pale Belgian, almost saison like. Palate is sweet, not sticky. Overall, a perfect Belgian Strong Pale here.

Golden colour, small white head. Aroma is fruity, mild alcohol and some slight sweet nectary notes. Flavour is fruity, sweet alcohol, some mild spice and mild honey as well.

750ml bottle @ PBF 2013 from a trade with pushkinwow. Thanks!

Pours clear orange with a large foamy head. Aroma of raw doughy notes, yeast, aged hops, grass, grainy malts and spices. Taste is sweet, alcoholy, hoppy, grainy and grassy with notes of yeast and spices. Finish is farmyardy, spicy and grainy with notes of toffee. A bit unbalanced and feels like its a bit past its prime already. Still quite good in a strange way, though.

750 ml bottle. 2010 vintage.
Pours a cloudy orange copper colour with a large foamy head. Aroma of sweet peach, grains and wort. Flavour of sweet caramel malts, sweet peach, grainy notes, herbs, weak bitterness, Belgian toffee and hay. Medium bodied, soft carbonation and smooth mouthfeel. Finishes sweet, grainy and herbal. Past its prime I think, if the intention was to make this hoppy as hell.

Bottled (2010 vintage) at PBF.  Cloudy golden, rich firm head. Plenty of pineapple and coriander up front. Mid sweet with near full body and soft mouthfeel. Laid back, despite relatively intense flavours of marzipan, tangerine and coriander. Long bitter finish. Combines new world flavours with old world feeling for details and depth. A winner!

75 cl bottle @ PBF 2013. 2010 vintage.
Pours hazy golden color with a large head. Aroma of sweet sugary notes, sweetish fruits, some caramel, yeast and very faint hops. Flavor of sweet fruits, caramel, yeast, faint hop notes, spices and some wood. Sadly seems to be slightly past it peak days.
4314

75 cl bottle vintage 2010 @ PBF VIII
Aroma quite yeasty and floury with some apricot. Flavour is quite strong on apricot. Also some soapy notes, herbal tones and spices. Very foamy and creamy palate. Nice, I like the apricot tones here.

750 ml bottle to snifter (shared with the Mrs.; thanks DuffMan). Looks good; a mostly mostly transparent vibrant orange with AMPLE white head and lively carbonation. Smells good; Belgian yeast, hops, straw, and spices with a fairly sweet, somewhat fruity backbone (maybe some apricot?). Tastes like it smells with a nice, lively mouthfeel. A good example of the style.

Blonde assez claire avec une mousse très riche et persistante. Odeure un peu fruitée avec des notes sucrés. En bouche la bière est crémeuse et a une amertume en debut de gorgée qui s?estompe rapidement pour faire place à des notes sucrées style miel. L?amertume revient en fin de gorgée mais n?est pas trop persistante. Aucun arriere goût ou goût trop intense en alcool même à 10%. Très bonne bière globalement à réessayer !
Bootle with a big go jump in a lake to Glouglouburp. So chill. nose is big potent flowers. Fog. Apples. Straw. Solid high boost farmhouse. Effervescent. Chill.
Holy crap. This might be the best beer Ive ever had. Im leaving my review at that. Go drink it.

750 ml shared by lushawn. Thanks, dude. Pours a nice darker hazed golden orange hue, nice darker glow, firm haze. Frothy whitish head is big, sticks around as a cakey layer, laces well. Aromas are dill a bigger hops, a firmer yeast presence, a bit tart with some bread, pear, tart apple. Some florals, straw, more dill and gentle spice. Initial is much different, a bit sweeter, honey crisp apples, dough, and gentle lemon. A touch sticky, some vanilla, and gentle spice.some gentle clove, ester, and honey. Backend is a touch of earth, floral and grass. Some gentle honeycomb, toast, and some firm florals and earthy hops. More Belgian gentle yeast, fruit, some spice and stickiness. Solid, the nose is completely different. Ok.

750 ml bottle shared by Loineshawn- thanks again, Shawn! This has been a very, very long-time member of my Wants list. Fancied bottle. Pours a somewhat cloudy golden color with a smallish white head. Notes of strong floral and citrusy hops on top of a sweet and bready Belgian malt profile. Mellow peppery spice and herbs, some dried apricot and white raisins. Medium-bodied, with a clean mouthfeel despite its sweetness and malt. Moderate carbonation. Really nice and different. Enjoyed this a lot.

On tap, clear golden pour with large off white head. Aroma of yeast, spice, caramel, apricot and hops. Taste of yeast, cotton candy, citrus, caramel, slightly fruity and floral. Full bodied, medium carbonation and a dry hoppy finish. Would have scored higher but just a little too much syrupy hops on the finish. Very good beer.

6/13/13. 750mL thanks to mathieuc! Clear orange pour with a light khaki head. Light skunk in the aroma with lots of candy sugar and dry hops. Sweet sugar in the flavor, pale malts, more candy sugar, and light hops. On the sweet side and a touch disappointing. A bit of a lingering dryness, but too sweet in the front and middle.

Pours an apricot color with a big white fluffy head. The nose is Caramelized fruit (apricot and peach). The pallet is super caramelly with notes of orange, citrus and apricot. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a cloudy straw with a huge, billowing head. Aromas of yeast, funk, spices. Smells pretty, like those old ladies who wear Chanel #5. Perfumy. Taste is citrus, lemon, funk, white pepper, hops. Huge carbonation. Pretty damn nice. Finish is spicy and dry, with a lingering pepper note. Very good.

Pour is a clear golden colour with a nice white head. Good lacing. Smells slightly of cider, fruits, spice, and hops. Taste is slightly sweet with a hint of spice and fruits. High carbonation. Almost like a champagne. Low to medium body.A great beer!

8 oz pour at Beer Revolution. Pours a muddled golden yellow with a bubbly white head. Aroma is of strong soft fruits, mild citrus. Mouthfeel is crisp, medium alcohol warmth. Taste is glorious. Delicately balanced, punch of hop flavour tempered with electrifiying sweetness, masking alcohol notes and leaving you scintillated and wanting more.

(750mL bottle from the LCBO) Pours a clear yellow-gold with a big fluffy white head, leaving a fair bit of lace. Aroma has floral hops, white grapes, citrus peel, a little sweet pale malt, some pepper and yeast. Flavour has a strong hop component, citrus and leafy with some sweet fruit and candy sugar as well, a bit of herbal note, some pepper, bready Belgian yeast. Finishes pretty herbal and hoppy for a Belgian strong, quite dry throughout for the style. Fine effervescent carbonation, alcohol very well hidden, delicious beer which is a balanced, tasty hybrid of classic old world with new world hops.

Bière blonde de 10 % dalcool. Elle possède un odorat floral et fruité. Elle est très mousseuse et très sucré. Elle est amère et possède un goût prenant en bouche. Elle a également un goût citronné. Elle a évidemment un goût prononcé en alcool, mais elle est quand même très bonne.

Pours a clear pale yellow with a huge fine off-white head.  Aroma is floral hops and white grape, with a little grapefruit pith bitterness, yeast, light spice and just a tiny hint of caramel.  Very effervescent  with a light body. The  taste is slightly sweet with bread and slight caramel malts and Belgian yeast with spice and lots of citrus (grapefruit) and herbal hops coming through for a pleasantly bitter finish.

Beer courtesy of Tommy.  Classify this as a Belgian DIPA.  Really hop forward with tons of citrus and floral hop notes with nice Belgian yeast characteristics that bring in a bready doughy element with light fruit esters.  Great beer.
Big thanks to tommy, thanks for the bottle! Fresh hop flavors on a rich strong Belgian tripel, the hops are delicious with the bElgin contrast. Big fan of this!

Clear yellow with a massive white head. Aroma is peppercorn, grape skins, grapefruit. Bitter on the palate with a hint  of sweetness in the background, somewhat dry finish. Taste is grape skins, grass, grapefruit, green peppercorns.

[bottle]
Pineapple, pine, and grapefruit pith aroma with some sweet malt and faint peppery phenolics. Pouring initially results in a clear yellow gold with a huge, eternal, rocky, off-white to tan head. Sweet and peppery phenolic flavour with a perfect balance of hops bitterness and prickly carbonation to the sweetness. Complex flavour contains white grape, grapefruit peel, and pineapple. Light to medium-light body, high to very high carbonation, tangy white grape finish together with a moderate bitterness.

Le liquide est blond claire avec une bonne effervescence.Le col est très épais,majestueux ,on dirait de la meringue et sa dentelle colle aux parois de mon verre.Le nez est des plus invitant,herbeux,chanvré,floral.Au goût,une entré en douceur sucré suivi par une amertume juste et franche qui est attendu vu ses 70 de ibu.Sa me rappel la triple de dominus.Lalcool est très bien dissimulé a travers les sucres et les houblons.

UPDATED: MAR 26, 2013 750 ml bottle Pours a hazy gold with huge pillowy head. Aromas of Belgian yeast, coriander, ginger, light toffee,  and citrus. Flavors of malt, bananas, coriander, pineapple, lemons, and a touch of spruce. Warm, smooth. and full. Excellent.

9th February 2013Bruces Birthday Bash at the Craft Clerkenwell. Thanks to Paul for this bottle. Hazy gold beer with a big pale cream coloured head. Light airy palate. Slightly soft and dry. Very sweet lactose, touch of caramel. Very mild hop fruits. Finishes light and dry. Curiously drinkable and so light and sweet.
Bottle gift from SJ. Citrus, Belgian spice, bread, candy, hops, with a nice sweet / bitter finish. I enjoyed this...not the typical Belgian strong.

Type Belgium strong ale, and what a great beer! With citrus/floral and a dough smell, pour a nice clear golden orange color, with a thick white head, and leaving very nice lacing.  Great tasting beer, one of the better Belgian type from Quebec.  Great looking, great taste and a very strong finish.  Totally enjoyed this one! Bravo Microbrasserie Charlevoix.

750 ml, 10%, peluso, 70 IBU. Blonde avec un beau 2 doigts de mousse. Odeur de houblon agrumes. Goute les agrumes, sucrée, et l'amertume du houblon très présent. Alcool bien masqué par l'amertume. 
Très bonne froide mais amertume un peu forte. Plus tiède, malt et houblon beaucoup mieux équilibrés

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle shared by BVery, thanks Brian! Pours hazy yellow with fruity and malt aromas. Taste is dry fruits, malts and strong hops. Slight funk finishes it.off perfectly.
Bottle sample from BVery. Pours hazy yellow gold. Aroma is light yeast fruit and malt. Taste is smooth fruity and dry. Palate is again dry thin and chalky. solid.

Bottle shared thanks to Brian! Cloudy yellow pour, bright fruit flavors give
way to strong hops. Really nice, just slightly funky.
UPDATED: DEC 29, 2013 Bottle via trade with Andrew - thanks! Hazy light yellow pour with a monster white head. Hoppy, citrus, and a little barnyard funk. This is awesome.

Millésime 2010. Cétait une des premières bières de micro que jai acheté, ya rien de trop beau ! Je lai donné en cadeau à un bon chum et on la partagé ensemble 3 ans plus tard. Bref, un beau moment.
Une belle couleur jaune dorée et une mousse très abondante sortent de ma Lupulus. Elle est trouble et ne montre pas de bulles.
Le nez est séducteur ! Abricot, raisin sucré, malt et sucre en abondance. La mousse est amère.
La bière ne lest pas (on sy attendait, layant laissé trop longtemps vieillir). Au contraire, elle est très sucrée et possède un corps très rond. Malt et sucre, à lapparence simple, mais tellement complexe en même temps ! Une des meilleures à vie !

Bottle @ Bruces birthday tasting. Cheers to Paul for snagging this top want! The pours deep gold with a massive pillowy head. The aromas hay, barnyard funk. Some belgian yeast. Sugar cookie, general spices. Notes of apple sauce. The taste is light brett, apple and cranberry jam. Acidic red apple skin, notes of grass, earth. Supple sweetness on the finish. Robust body, but smooth and easy to drink. Overall, a very well-made beer. Quite a bit fruitier than I expected. Solid stuff, this didnt blow me away...

Dangereuse! Ne goute pas son 10% d'alcool! Col agressif. Odeur fruité. un goût À la fois fruitée et houblonnée, très  bien équilibré. Un vrai délice!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at Bruces 30th celebrations, 08/02/13, sorry - didnt note who to thank on this one - Paul?
Hazed golden amber with a big frothy white head that retains well.
Nose is Belgian yeasts, light floral tones, sugar, citrus.
Taste follows, dose of booze.
Full end of medium bodied, the alcohol is well disguised, some bitterness in a dry finish.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle shared at Bruces 30th. It pours clear golden yellow with a massive white head. The nose is apricot, panettone, spice, wood, toasted brioche, orange and candied peel - very nice indeed! The taste is spice, citrus peel, apricot, orange, tangerine, hay, panettone, crisp bitterness and alcohol warmth with a dry finish. Medium-full body and moderate carbonation. Not my favourite style, but this example is well balanced and elegant.
UPDATED: AUG 3, 2013 Superbe bière amère et très florale.  La mousse est délicieuse, consistante et persistante. Sont goût est équilibré.

Superbe blonde de style tripel, une de mes préférées à vie, toutes catégories confondues. Le fort taux dalcool est admirablement caché par les savoureuses notes de houblons et de sucres quelle présente. Superbement balancée, étonnamment accessible, chaque gorgée est un délice.

Sainte-réserve 2010. Pours a slight hazy, rich golden colour with a huge creamy warm cap that has great retention and lacing. This one does not look like it cellars well, as I do not feel the grapefruit notes (from the hop). Still, pretty good. Fruity aromas with lots of malts, herbs Belgian Ale yeast and a little alcohol. The taste is pretty sweet at first, with nice apples in the middle and the hop showing up in the finish, giving this one a little bitterness. Like Pootzboy wrote, reminds me of a Duvel. Maybe a little better.

Hazy golden-orange body, massive foamy white head. Substantial lacing.  Nose shows grassy and spicy hops, light fruits, Belgian zesty yeast. Flavor is a little less grassy, more citric and tropical fruits, classic golden Belgian ale spicing. Medium bodied, zest finish, mild bitterness, a bit boozy. The real deal.

UPDATED: FEB 15, 2013 Bouteille 750ml. Mini gushing. Couleur or trouble, mousse blanche abondante et crémeuse qui persiste longuement, laissant une légère dentelle. Arôme de levure, agrumes, houblon, fraîcheur, résine, pamplemousse. Goût de miel, houblon, pamplemousse, amertume qui nous accompagne tout au long de la gorgée. Carbonation faible, corps dense. Excellente.
Bouteille de 750 ml, belle mousse résiduelle.  Biere pratiquement parfaite, cest 10% dalcool ni parait pas.  Superbe bière au nez et au gout.  Un must.

750ml bottle.  Pours a slightly hazy pale yellow with a GIANT head of fine white bubbles.  Watch out!  Smells great.  Lemon, yeast, mango, paraffin, honey, alcohol, peppercorn, and some floral notes.  Taste starts with some sweet undertones followed by an large immediate hit of bitter Euro style hopping, yeast, tropical fruit notes, and grapefruit, with some definite alcohol.  Though I have only had four beers from this brewery, they have all been excellent.  Time for another trip to Quebec.

Yeah.  Magnum via MartinT and shared with my Dad over Christmas Eve billiards in the basement.  Nose is rumball covered hop.  A bit of yeast in the finish of the nose for good measure.  TA tantalizing mixture of malts, hop and yeast twine about my tongue.  Lightly hazy gdeep gold in the glass.  Thick white head lolls about like a ship in rough seas....or was that my general jaunting gait?  Hmmmm.  Paired well with Mas lasagne.  Dad seemed to enjoy this beer as he got more than I did.  Robust and rounded the honey tone works its way out of  all the malt and tangyness.  Finish is long and lovely. Simcoe abounds.  Nice!
Pours a hazy golden with lots of carbonation. Aroma is Belgian candy with hops, very unique. Taste is also, bitter hoppyness and a sweet Belgian style. Great beer.

750 mL bottle from the LCBO, served in a tulip. Pours clear golden with a huge, dense, pillowy white head. The head remains and leaves a moderate amount of fine lace. On the nose, there are notes of noble hops, pine and citrus, with grass, honey, caramel and spice. The flavour is moderately sweet with caramel and honey. This is balanced with yeast and significant peppery, citric notes that enter through the middle. The finish is long, hoppy bitter, peppery and grassy. On the palate, it is medium in body, with a smooth, oily texture and average carbonation. Overall, this is a nice ale. Sort of IPA meets tripel. It has a nice nose and a big spicy-sweet-bitter flavour but the alcohol is a little too conspicuous for my taste. 2012-04-12
UPDATED: MAR 10, 2013 Sweet, crisp, well balanced and damn tasty. Really cant say enough good things about this. Has a nice hit of hops, but does not over power, great stuff.

semi cloudy orange amber body with thick, frothy beige-white head of 3 fingers.   aromas are very complex:  musk, apricot, pear, apple and autumn fruit and notes of nutmeg and cedar???  Too complex for my novice beer somelier lore / vocab.  flavor is sweet with some lingering tartness in the finish.  Delightfully smooth throughout the sampling.  Dangerously drinkable.
Belle robe, parfum de café. Goût de caramel avec une pointe damertume. Saveur plus gouteuse quand elle est chambrée.

(en fût à la Succursale): Cest pas à chaque fois quune image olfactive aussi puissante nous frappe dès la première gorgée...Huile de morue! Bottle 750 ml. Pours cloudy golden yellow with thick long lasting creamy white head. Nice lacing. Aroma and flavour: citrus, hops, belgian yeast. Dry bitter hoppy taste. Excellent balance, alcool is well hidden. Awesome beer from Charlevoix!

The price put me off this one at first, but heck, compared to a bottle of pricey wine this is a steal. Ive been burned on expensive brews that werent worth it (hello, Innis & Gunn!), so I shied away for a while. But since this was from Quebec, I gave it a chance.
Glad I did. This is like an Orval on steroids: same dry-hopped bitterness, but taken to extreme with way more alcohol punch. Thats not a bad thing unless youre driving something besides a wheelchair. Im a Belgo-Canadian and Ive drunk most top Belgian ales, and this could stand among them. For some reason, Quebec knows how to deliver.
Way drier than other Quebecois faves like Fin du Monde, so kudos to the brewer for finding their own direction when it comes to Belgian inspiration: these guys are really on to something, and its very rare for me to say that spending $12 on a bottle of beer was worth it. It was.
Im not a snob who downgrades for the sake of it: the top ratings are there for a reason, and this beer deserves them all IMO. Not for everyone, but definitely for me.
To my pal in Nunavut, Ill ship you as many as you like as long as you pay the cost.You shouldnt go without when youre so close to the pole youre practically dancing on it!

750ml bottle. 2011. Pours a slightly cloudy yellow body with an enormous white fluffy head, incredible retention. Strong aroma of yeast, banana, cinnamon, honey, apple cider, herbal-floral hops. Hazy golden with a large white head. Aroma is fruity, floral, light spice, yeast, sweet. Tingly carbonation in the medium body. Flavor has real nice sweet fruits, tropical, floral, light honey, a touch of yeast spice. Quite nice. 2009 bottle. Thanks, TimE.

Arrived in a large 750ml wine-like bottle that I wonder if I can homebrew with. Will the caps fit? One may find out  in the months to come! Pours with colossally large head, really way too big and too feisty even by Belgian standards. Off that huge head, however, comes a gueuze-like Belgian blonde aroma that I have so much missed living here in the arctic with just Molson macros (mostly) to choose from. Hints of hops and caramel, dry wit citrus on the back end. Very refreshing, I could just sit here and smell this all day long, it reminds me I need to get to Brussels and its farmlands with the wild yeasts again sometime in the coming years; but anyways. The flavour is a smooth mix of hops and sugar with hints of fruits like banana in there, soft sweet caramel hints, you know theyre sweetening it up but in such a way that its not overbearing and still quite delicious. Nice mouthfeel and an okay finish. This is easily the best Belgian-style blonde Ive had from the new world, and am glad I air-freighted a pile of them up here. The problem is, I just know theyll disappear too quickly.....

750mL bottle from the Lickbow. Pours a nice gold with a huge white head. This is actually the hardest beer Ive ever had to pour, it just instantly turns into foam once it leaves the bottle. This is worse than Orval. When it settles 4 hours later, you get a huge whiff of a hop medley, with delicious pale and Belgian-esque malts underneath and some old-fashioned bubblegum. Piney, citrusy, peppermint-y, pretty much every descriptor you can imagine for hops, its in here. The flavour....wow. Its like if a Belgian strong blonde ale married a bunch of hops, and their child was one of those insanely over-achieving kids who actually has trouble not succeeding in everything they do, that kid would be this beer. I have few words to describe the ideal balance here of everything. Ive had beers at 5% abv which had more booze present in their flavour. This one has a huge, rich malty palate, balanced with a plethora of hop flavours and mild hop bitterness which lingers and bites the back of the tongue. Spicy, mildly yeasty. Unbelievable. This beer is objectively fantastic. I just wish it cost less than $1100 a bottle.

From notes.  First reviewed 3/14/2011.  Poured from a 750 mL bottle into a tulip. 2009 vintage. Thanks to Dunt for sharing his bottle.

Out of the bottle this pours a pleasantly cloudy golden yellow color. A huge white head with lots of fluffy lace displays great retention. 

The aroma is candy sweet pale malt with a generous helping of spicy Belgian yeast. Clove is the dominant spice, followed by a burst of floral and citrus hoppiness.

The flavor is fairly simple but incredibly well proportioned. Sweet candi and pale malt open up the palate. A pleasant but not overwhelming Belgian yeast follows, imparting flavors of clove, coriander, and orange peel. Some grapefruit and tangerine citrus combine with the spice to provide a nice hop finish. The end of each sip is clean and refreshing.

The crisp, clean carbonation is very evident and helps display the flavor characteristics well. The bubbles are soothing and complement the medium to full body well, never letting on this has a 10% ABV.

Smooth and clean, this is as balanced and delicious as any Belgian IPA I have had.

The mouthfeel is clean, round, soft and light tart with a light carbonation. Light phenolic, bready and bitter finish. Medium bodied.

Vieillie de deux ans! Bière forte en amertume et à saveur dalcool intense.  Une acidité est très présente.  Elle me fait penser à la Duvel.  Il est possible que mon échantillon était un peu vieux et la bière était légèrement madérisée.  Léquilibre était quelque peu déstabilisée.  Autrement, à boire tranquillement.
#1042 bottle; Nose Is heavy green apple acid, mediumdry grass, later menthol, lemon, feel is mediumbroad, carb is medium, taste is decent amarillo, tulip, piss, dry lemon, late bitter hops bite

Pour is slightly hazy yellow with white head, pour thanks to Aaron! Aroma has notes of nice fruit with pear and apricot, crackery bread with yeast notes, hints of spice and nice slight floral notes, pretty much a delicious saison.  Taste is a nice mix of fruity pear, apricot, dried apricot, green raisin, hints of floral and slight biscuit, finishes fairly sweet but dries out nicely.  This is delicious stuff, wish I could have this all the time.

Bottle @ home, courtesy of pushkinwow. Huge thanks! A touch hazy, golden appearance with a huge, carbonated, a touch off white head. Citrusy, Belgian yeasty, really nice citrusy bready, somewhat spicy aroma. Spicy, very tasty wheat malty, orange citrusy, slightly grassy, spicy yeasty, moderate barnyard, bready, tangy flavor. Excellent beer! Glad to have tried this!
Bottle.  Yellow pour with a big white head.  Lemon zest and straw aromas.  Lemon, citrus, and spices.  Very saison like..

Bière de couleur blonde voilée avec un superbe col de couleur crème. Au nez, cest plutôt acidulé, des odeurs dagrumes frais et dun houblon assez efficace pour titiller les papilles olfactives. En bouche cest amer et sucré suivi dun goût assez franc dalcool. Un arrière-goût persistant qui flâne sur plusieurs parties de la langue. (021011)

Bottle: &nbsp Bright straw, a little fiery, huge rocky white head, very nice lacing. &nbsp Its also a bit cloudy towards the last pour. &nbsp Bright floral nose, barnish, slight candied citrus peel. &nbsp Smells Belgian, and smells fantastic. &nbsp Not as bright on the tongue, musty pale, hard to believe its 10%. &nbsp Finish is a little tangy. &nbsp Hops are soft, sweet, and citrusy. &nbsp Belgian Strong meet IIPA, or so it would seem. &nbsp Fantastic stuff! &nbsp Thanks for sharing Shaughn!

2010 bottle from kevinsenn. Massive piles of big foamy head that tastes of sweet grapefruit. The huge alcohol content is masked beautifully. 70 IBUs you dont really notice, its just a big smooth fruity mouthful of goodness. Taste reminds me slightly of 3Floyds Zombie Dust, but more Belgian (obviously). Aroma is mild and a bit yeasty, pours a hazy gold. What a lovely beer. Edit: after a while, as you drink, the bitterness starts to come out more and more. Still lovely.

UPDATED: APR 2, 2012 [2010 Bottle, nearly 2 years old]: 750mL 2010 bottle from Broue Ha Ha.  Was very excited to try this one and it did not disappoint.  Pours cloudy and gold with a massive thick creamy head.  Citrus hops, spice, and yeast dominate the aroma.  Taste is heavenly.  Belgian spiciness and sweetness mixed with fruity hops, with a mildly bitter grapefruit finish.  Very smooth in the mouth with moderate carbonation, and warming alcohol.  Delicious stuff!  [2012 bottle from LCBO, a couple months old]: Clear golden with a huge creamy white head.  Terrific aroma of sweet malt, citrus fruits, spice, and bubblegum.  Taste is wonderful: sweet up front with fruity hops (orange and lemon), and a delicate Belgian bubble-gum goodness.  The 70 IBUs give it a great bitter grapefruit finish.  A little boozy.  Medium-bodied with a nice slick mouthful and good carbonation.  Definitely better fresh!

Mondial de la Bière 2011, Strasbourg - hazy golden-blond beer with a creamy white foam left; estery, chewy and perfumy; some fruity esters; full-bodied, sticky and tasty, dry and fairly bitter; residual sugars and a perfumy estery and hoppy finish
This beer is tremendous. Complex aroma of grass, citrus and Belgian yeast funkiness. More yeast on the tongue with lots of hops that give way to a sweet, estery finish.

Bottle 750 ml 2010 Vintage 
Aroma:  flowery , herbal softness, aromatic with soft Belgian yeast notes. Gentle and pleasant. Dryness at edges. 8-
Appearance:  hazed amber gold with  large foamy top. Thick long lasting white cap. Neatly laced glass. 4-
Body , Flavour , Palate and Final Notes:  Medium bodied. Soft , dry herbal floral feel. Sublime slightly tart hop character. Dry. Stronger Orval like yet you notice that only by getting friendly buzz. Very drinkable , approachable from every side. Very well balanced. I was expecting solid beer and I got absolutely world class champion. Solid, solid brew. Highly recommended.

Bottle. Pours a slightly cloudy golden color with a very lively white head. Big sticky left on the glass as the head settles. Soft aroma of fruit and spice. Some must. Very soft on the palate. Peach, apricot, and pear flavor are really nice. Really nice and flavorful. Easy drinking.

Bottle. [thanks cfrancis]
Pours completely clear yellow-golden to orange. Lots of bubbles and a giant, staying, frothy white head. Wonderful looks. Aroma is vinious, green apple, mild brett, crisp malt, oats, esters, light elderflower and citrus. Highish carbonation, fat and light oily palate. Flavour is elegant, apples, exotic fruit, warming, some oranges, citrus, light bretty, lots of grass. Lingering bitterness.

750 ml bottle from Premier Wine and Spirits (Halifax).  Pours a hazy golden orange with good-sized creamy white head and some lace.  Aroma is yeasty with fruit, spice and a mostly floral hopiness.  Flavour is lots of slightly sour apple/pear, spice and decent floral/citric finish.  Alcohol quite hidden; smooth mouthfeel.  Very nice.

Pours a golden straw color with a massive, white head possessing outstanding retention. Pour this one slowly! On the nose is citrus, grapefruit, orange, green grapes, grassy/herbal hops, pine, sweet malts, clove, banana, pineapple, and yeast. Has a musty/woody/earthy quality to it. Mouth feel is medium, with good carbonation and a slight alcohol burn which is not at all unpleasant. Taste-wise, I get citrus, very sweet honey malt, champagne, wine, green grapes, fresh flowers, some yeasty funk, cloves, pine, and substantial amount of bitter hops near the end. Finish is long, dry and hoppy, leaving citrus, banana, grapefruit, burnt toast, ash and charred wood. An incredible balance of sweet and bitter flavors with neither becoming too cloying. This beer really reminds me of a good champagne.

10 bottle from James - thanks!  Pours a clear copper yellow with a large off-white head and steady carbonation.  Aroma is soft clove, subtle candied sugar, and a light touch of sweet malt through the finish.  Taste is clove up front followed by black pepper, candied sugar, some nice "holiday" spices I cannot identify with detail, and an interesting hop bitterness followed by a honey-like sweetness through the finish.  Perfectly enjoyable belgian strong but no better, and actually inferior in some instances, than quality takes on the same style that are readily available on the shelf locally.

Sampled from bottle at DLD in April. Pours very cloudy amber color with a thick head. Just a slightly hoppy smell. Very interesting taste, almost like candy. Yet not that sweet. Very surprising, with Belgian specialty malt, pale ale hops, and a very easy drinking palate.

Poured a hazy golden color with a large, off white head that left nice lacing on the glass. Aroma of floral hops, orange peel, pine, a bit of toasted dough, citrus fruits, light ginger, and other seemingly Belgian spices. Taste of pine, orange peel, citrus fruits, simcoe, white pepper, a bit of grass, and a bitter, finish with some alcohol in there as well

pours mildly cloudy yellow, superb thick and lasting head, clinging lacing. Bright tangerine and lemon citrus aromas on the nose. Initial effervescent tangerine flavour come through straight down the middle, followed by a thick and rich honey warmth, finishing with a pleasant nutmeg on the exhale. Fine carbonation holds all the flavours together and the 70 IBUs provide an excellent backbone and tail to complete the experience. High complexity, long length, high potency (ABV), very smooth & drinkable, high depth. A very, very solid beer with fruity sweet, and sharp bitterness, with medium spices. This beer is an adventurous trip.
Bottle thanks to Glouglouburp.  Pours a clear golden color with a huge white head.  Nose is of lemon, spice and yeast.  Taste is of lemon rind and spices.  Mouthfeel is dry.
bottle at Volo, thanks Ralph. blonde golden tripel like pour. fuller body. spritzy, Belgian yeastiness, candi sugar, coriander spice, lemon rind. all these flavors are wound into one impressive beer

Golden with a dense white head. Nose was spicey, floral, and fruity. Taste had apples, floral, and tropical fruit notes. The beer started with a sweet pilsner malt, and finished with a dry bitterness. Really enjoyable.

Orangey yellow colour with a thick and whispy head. Beautiful lace retention. Exceptionally bitter hop flavors bursting through the sparkling aroma of grass, citrus, and spice. Mouthfeel is excellent. There is a solid body to the liquid and the head is creamy and smooth. Bitter but not harsh, flavorful and malty but not too sweet. This is a divine brew.

Bottle shared by the awesome emacgee.  Pours golden, orange-tinted, with a generous white head.  Nose shows lots of Saaz-y hops grassy and citric.  Taste delivers.  Hard to believe this bottle is a year old. Lovely soft palate.

Shared by turdferguson. Pours a brilliant clean straw gold with two fingers of fizzy offwhite head. Hoppy dry peppery nose, citrusy and yeasty with grassy notes. Peppery flavor with a spicy grassy hop bite with some yeasty notes and a citrus rind character. Dry and peppery palate with a lively carbonation.

2010 Bottle, thanks Shaun.  Hazy golden orange with thick white head.  Quite grassy, some spicy hops, a little citrus and some light sweetness.  Overall very dry and still pretty darn hoppy for being brewed in 2010.

Grassy piney hops on the nose with hints of sweet malts.  Pours golden blonde with a dense and thick white head.  Citrus hops with spicy Belgian yeast flavors, cinnamon and allspice with grassy hops and a sweet and spicy finish that feels a little sticky.  Pretty good beer, very complex with lots of flavor from the bold hop flavors to the Belgian yeast.

Bottle, shared with tarheels. Pours yellow/gold with a massive white head with excellent retention/lacing. Aroma is rich citrus, pineapple, grassy hops, spicy belgo yeast, banana, clove. Flavor is very yeasty/hoppy, candy sugar, with a nice banana presence and some booziness. Finish is long, bitter, a bit yeasy. The best Dominus Deus to date.

750mL thanks to Glouglouburp. The pour is a lightly hazy gold with a massive ice cream float head with superlative rockiness. Huge ice cream scoop retention and gigantic lace all over the oversized Tripel Karmeliet tulip. Nose is very similar to Gouden Carolus Hopsinjoor: small abbey tripel banana and cloves and candi sugar with a healthy dose of grassy and sharp hops (Saaz and Amarillo come to the front). Small celery and estery yeast reminds me of Saison Dupont yeast. Taste upfront is pretty alcohol heavy with a major league banana and spice character. Very Belgian all around really puts this as almost a clone of Hopsinjoor or higher gravity Saison Dupont, ie Avec les bon Voeux. Palate is heavy, soft carbonation, slightly nutty bitter (Simcoe?). But overall this is pretty sweet, loads of musty yeast and sweeter saison notes like Southampton Cuvee des Fleurs. Sweet juicy orange and bitter orange peel come through. Very nice stuff, but not really superior to any of the beers I mentioned above.

What a beautiful beer. Oily feel in the mouth. Amazing range of aromas as you savour it. Grassy hops, sweeter elements like a hint of caramel. These guys just make great beer no matter how you look at it.

Sainte réserve 2010! WOW. Une BSA très bien balancée quoique plus houblonné que la normale du style. Servie dans un verre de triple carmélite. La cheminée de mousse dominait la majeure partie du verre. Du nez ressort le houblon, la levure belge et le sucre. Elle est très crémeuse en bouche. Elle est assez sucrée et parfaitement amère.

Bottle shared by Doug, thanks 
Appearance: Clear yellow with a huge foamy white head and great lacing 
Aroma: Banana esters, coriander and belgian yeast 
Taste: Sweet caramel, banana and coriander 
Nice

750 ml bottle picked up in Montreal. Not triangular shaped like the photo on RB. Pours a clear copper color with a huge white head. Very foamy so pour gently. The aroma is a massive sweet sugary mix with Belgian malts, apples, floral hops. The flavor is very distinct and unique; initially super sweet blends of fruity spicy hops, light citrus, sugary and sweet Belgian malts, like a great candy. Peppery some Simcoe slides in. Just lovely. Very drinkable. I wish I had a bottle or two to just drink by myself and get....happy. The sweetness is somehow balanced and very smooth. Nothing over the top just well done and unique goodness.

Bottle 2010 vintage,  Wow this beer was quite something. at first I was alittle disappointed the aroma was a bit basic, it smelt just like your normal belgian smell. Which is still good but I thought it would be just another belgian. But when you sip it at first it was just wow. The beer is a yellow golden colour. The taste is of belgian yeast mix with a nice amount of spices and hops. The beer just a good mix of everything. It was very tasty stuff and good for drinking. I would love to get some more of this.

750ml bottle, 2010 vintage, from trade (thanks CFrancis). Pours a hazy yellow with a voluminous off white head and good lace. Aroma is pineapple and melon with a nicely hoppy and estery dominance. Flavour is pineapple and a lot of good fresh hoppiness with a nice yeasty spiciness with some metallic notes. Finish is tart but wonderfully lingering in both hops and fruitiness. Alcohol very well hidden. Excellent.

Bottle. Fantastic brew, glad i picked up a second one. Deep golden and ornage in the pour with a thick creamy white head. Bright citrus with ornage peel and yeasty with a bit of a spicey finish on the tounge. An excellent brew indeed.
Bottle...  Poured golden with a huge, fluffy white head.  Nice body, a little dry towards the finish.  Nice honey tone and good sweetness.  Yeast spice, malted grains, and vanilla.

Ok, well, I didnt really have anything special laid out for tick #2800, so let me go with a beer I had that really impressed me.  750ml bottle thanks to flipper2gv on BA via trade.  This one comes from ABOOT (LOL Canadians sound so goofy) an hour or two up the bay from Quebec city.  Great appearance, mostly clear golden color with a huge white head and great lacing.  Sweet malt on the aroma along with a great hoppiness, grassy, herbal, and pineapple-like.  The flavor is light yet powerful, with a sweet pale malt base and honey seamlessly integrated with a pineapple, orange, and floral hoppiness.  So damn tasty.  Medium-bodied with a smooth mouthfeel, and belies the 10% ABV, as the booziness is practically non-existent.  Yep, this is just ABOOT (haha) the best Ive had from Canada.  Brew some more beers like this, eh chaps?

Bouteille 750 mL - Couleur dorée avec une belle coiffe quasi éternelle. Arômes de pin et dépices fruitées. Belle rondeur en bouche. Le sucré est très bien équilibré avec lamertume du houblon. Goût de pommes/poires, clou de girofle et dépinette. Lalcool se ressent un tout petit peu à la fin mais on ne devinerait jamais les 10%! Une des meilleurs bières que jai dégustées à ce jour.

Bouteille 750 ml verte achetée chez Chamard. En ouvrant la bouteille, ma peur sest confirmée. Lentreposage au commerce ne fut pas adéquat et le produit a commencé a "skunké". Dommage car malgré lodeur de mouffette qui sinstallait, de bonne arôme de fleur, de citron et de miel la perçait. Sa robe plus près du doré que du blond était légèrement brouillée. Belle rondeur et belle mousse persistante. En bouche, elle a un bel équilibre entre lamertume, lalcool et le sucre résiduel.

750 ml bottle. Hazy blonde color, foamy white head (and its a persistent one!). Fizzy, lighly hoppy at first, pale fruits are dominant in the taste. Comple yeast flavors. Agrume, bananas and honey give the sweet mouthfeel that comes first and then is balanced by the bitterness of hop and yeast. I waited a few months before I drank it, should have drank it first, because Im pretty sur the flavors would have been even more agressive (in a good way!).

Extremely clear golden orange colour. Frothy, very pure white head. Medium carbonation. Very pure looking beer. Lovely spice/herb aroma. Very pleasant and appealing floral, herb flavour. Spicy fruity flavour. Nice bitterness. Rich, almost sickly finish.

750ml bottle provided to me by Freud...A honey gold beer, nice looking with huge amounts of carbonation, a gusher so be careful when you pour as it foams up super quick. At least four fingers of off white head rises up. Great fluffy retention and lacing...The aroma is light honey on the front with lots of yeast and floral hops. I hate to steal Alexs line but this is very similar to Duvel. The taste is basically spot on with the aroma, yeast dominated with floral hops, but this is sweetness comes through a lot more, so this is a very sweet Duvel.

A very good and tastey beer worth getting a hold of. Doing Canada proud.

Bottle from CFrancis. Pour golden slightly hazy great pillowy head and terrific lacing. Aroma very floral and grassy. Taste wow big bitter grassy and floral hops, spicy Belgian yeast cloves and a lingering taste that reminds me of Columbus hops. Medium to full body with faint but good carb. Awesome I love hoppy Belgians so this was win!!

Bottle shared by someone at the post EBF tasting, thanks! Poured a clear gold with a white head that lasted throughout the beer.
